> 1) Is there a reason why the Report screen was designed to only
> display status codes/mime type info only during a crawl and not after
> a job has been completed? Seems like this report would be equally
> useful post-crawl.

All the reports are written to files at the end of a crawl. In particular,
the mime type info is written to "mimetype-report.txt". So all that info
is preserved after the end of a crawl even though it isn't accessible via
the web UI.

> 2) Has anyone developed a set of R or GNUplot scripts for processing
> the ARC files of a finished job? A set of scripts that can plot the
> distribution of MIME types, URIs, etc.
> would be really useful to me, and I'll probably write them myself
> unless someone already has.

Not that I know of. If the crawl.log contains all the necessary
information it would probably be simpler and more efficient to parse it
rather then the ARC files. In either case I'm sure that many others would
be interested in such statistical analysis tools should you choose to
write and share them.

- Kris
